Posts.Content: Brilliant news! Hope that you have a splendid Christmas, sure that you will now!
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: Brilliant news! Hope that you have a splendid Christmas, sure that you will now!
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: I rang PALS and asked them. They sent me an application form and an address to send it to. Think it was something like 'Central Records' at my hospital address. Someone from there then contacted me and asked me to forward a cheque. (For £ 10.00 in my case). I then recd paper copies of scan reports and letters to GP and a DVD with operation notes, pathology reports and pictures of scans......although I have not yet managed to access the scans....i keep meaning to ring them - the young man I spoke to was very helpful said to ring him if I had any trouble accessing the DVd.....he gave me a password for the scans - keep meaning to ring him.....
Posts.Title: I want to look at my scans and other tests

Posts.Content: hello Elaine.........I am also on LETROZOLE - I started it on the 14th December, and like you I will find out in a few weeks if it is being effective. I had a R Mx in November and the pathology reports afterwards showed that my cancer had spread. I have lobular cancer and do not have a significant tumour but lots of little one ....which in the words of the surgeon are like "grains of sand". They willl do blood tests they tell me as I have high calcium levels which are "tumour markers" And hopefully will decrease if the LETROZOLE works.............don't fully understand this yet, but have the questions ready for my next visit........................I have read about KatieG's success with her tumour shrinking and take some reassurance from that? Side effects for me have been aching joints, and headaches. ..but nothing unbearable and if it's working then I'll accept it.. Hope it works for you, I shall read your posts ........... All the best
Posts.Title: Letrozole as 1st treatment

Posts.Content: I am pretty new here, but finding a great deal of help from the site. I have come across a couple of terms/words which I don't understand so can someone tell me What is neutropenic?    think I've seen that on chemo posts and what are mets....think I've seen that in regard to bones? I've looked in the dictionary, but I haven't googled them. thanks anyone
Posts.Title: What is the meaning of...?

Posts.Content: I have entered every big city within travelling distance to me and there appears to be nothing. I live near York, leeds,Harrogate, Doncaster, Sheffield etc... I'll ask my breast nurse she may know somewhere local(ish)........I,d like to try some kind of social gathering as I sometimes feel a bit isolated . Recovering from bilateral Mx on Wednesday and would like to find more info about prosthesis and Mx bras since not having recon. You can only read so much can't you? Not feeling too bad though after the op.
Posts.Title: 'Look good, feel better' session

Posts.Content: Thank you both....I will contact York hospital tomorrow. That 's where I am having all of my treatment so is very convenient. Tried the website but kept telling me there was nothing local.......probably pressed a wrong key somewhere.
Posts.Title: 'Look good, feel better' session

Posts.Content: After I had my Mx one of my dressings was very uncomfortable.......I rang my GP surgery and they arranged for the practise nurse to change it.......I live about 40 minutes drive from the hospital and my BCN suggested this to save the journey.......if necessary though I would have driven to the hospital, once it was changed I was much more comfortable.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy plasters

Posts.Content: My fingers are crossed........come back tomorrow and tell us how the results were........... Sending love
Posts.Title: Second time around? Results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Thanks for posting this.....it is such an inspiration toi those of us who are just starting out..........
Posts.Title: Finished Rads now Tamoxifen!!!

Posts.Content: Hello sue. I am so pleased to hear that you're feeling okay after your treatment. I have followed your post because I also have secondaries so I think I have some idea how you feel. Mostly okay and ready to fight, but sometimes overwhelmed by it all. Reading the responses that you got from other people on here was also reassuring for me. Other people say things much better than I can but I just wanted to say that I am also sending you love and hugs. Glad you had a good Christmas, we did as well, as you say....doing 'normal' things. I see that you posted in the early hours. I was also awake then if I'd seen you post we could have had a bit of a gossip maybe!!! All the best keep your chin up!
Posts.Title: its spread so scared

Posts.Content: Hello everyone A couple of hours ago I had a call from the surgeon with the results of my CT scan. He said he would ring as soon As he knew..................... I have "definate shadows in chest area of spine...the upper bit". ...........and also "Impressions of deposits in lower abdomen, (he says it is in the lining of the abdomen)......especially pelvic area". .........so he has referred me to oncology and there will be no surgery on my left breast............my cancer can be treated by chemo or hormone therapy so we will discuss this with them on Thursday............. I am shaken...............husband and I have just wept together...................on the 8th October I was not even diagnosed wirh BC and STILL do not feel ill ..............stopped crying now and am feeling better ...........does anyone have any suggestions........what questions to ask on Thursday.................where I can do some research without frightening myself too much.............. Anyone any similar experiences.....................surgeon did say he would see me in his clinic to start filling the expander I has put in when I had my Mx...........if I ask will they just remove it...........don't think I want to bother with that now................rather be flat chested and just get on with living without that faffing ......................also still have cancer in my other breast.......will they do a Mx on that if I ask them..........well I will just ask them anyway!!!!!!!!! .............sorry being very blunt ............ Do not know how I will get through tonight.........husband either.......but we will
Posts.Title: Results not good

Posts.Content: Thanks for your advice and support....................I am compiling a list of questions and am going to phone the Macmillan help line this afternoon .....................my BCN is on holiday this week otherwise I would speak to her ..................... I don't seem able to have a good cry...............my husband held me for a long time last night, and we cried together, but when I do get emotional I try to let it out but somehow, without trying, I swallow it back......................, I have always been a bit reserved so maybe that 'S why....... ,,..I do feel a bit better today having read more on the secondary breast cancer site........ Again thanks for responding. X
Posts.Title: Results not good

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for all of your support...... Saw the oncologist last Thursday and the treatment plan is hormone therapy.......... Have started LETROZOLE. He has referred me for a bone scan since bone thinning can be an issue with this therapy.................also a blood test to see if bone cancer has leaked calcium ................ So more results to wait for. And every set of results that I have been given have shown a 'surprise' Forgot to ask him if they would remove the other breast in which they have also found cancer.....................will remember next time.............. I am trying to get some semblance of normality back, Christmas shopping and decorations this weekend!!!! Nnn
Posts.Title: Results not good

Posts.Content: I had a bilateral Mx and had the same problem with my scars. ..... After the dressings were removed.......Saw my GP initially who prescribed steroid cream which made it better but came back when I stopped using it. I saw my BCN who said to really put lots of E45 on and then leave my clothes off as long as possible to let it soak in.......this worked well for me. The itching was awful and the redness.....I could have taken a Brillo pad to it!!!!!!
Posts.Title: A Tickly Itchy Problem .........

Posts.Content: thanks for that mistymoley.........not sure how to do a pm......do I add you as a friend?
Posts.Title: Date for Mx and feeling low

Posts.Content: I am seeing the surgeon on Thursday and they have me down for mastectomy and full lymph node removal....my op is scheduled for 8 November.................. I have had about 6 biopsies taken from different areas of my breast and they all showed cancer........that seems like an awful lot of cancer......but I have no lumps, puckering, pain or thickening.....because nothing is apparent I was thinking that it must have been caught early....but since there has been so many positive biopsies I am thinking it must be well spread out. I have lobular cancer............... Also had biopsies from lymph nodes which showed cancer so they are removing them............I Assume that it is routine to remove them all if canc is found in some.......... I'm feeling a bit down now, Less than 2 weeks ago the doctor agreed that she couldn't feel anything either Seems unbelievable........
Posts.Title: Date for Mx and feeling low

Posts.Content: Yes they are doing reconstruction when they do the op on the 8th................I have to discuss what I want on Thursday .........they tell me that there will be a plastic surgeon there st the same time as they do th Mx...........I must get my head round it all before hen. The BCN gave me a book on reconstruction so that I could read it up.........haven't looked at it properly yet.......been in a bit of a daze. .................they say I will have chemo and then radiotherapy..........
Posts.Title: Date for Mx and feeling low

Posts.Content: You don't sound at all smug...........trust me if that we're to happen to me I'd be shouting.........perhaps I should say WHEN that happens to me .........you're an inspiration.
Posts.Title: Chemo is working - yippee

Posts.Content: Hello Tracey. Just wanted to say that you should have been given exercises to do after your Mx.....they're quite important as well so if you still don 't have any ask your BCN...............very gently at first obviously........but they are necessary
Posts.Title: recent diagnosis has left me stunned.

Posts.Content: I cannot answer your question but would just like to say that I dislike intensely nurses/pharmacists who insist on informing people how much their medication costs...... I have a very dear friend who has lots of medical problems and is on many medications. Every time she has her repeat prescription filled they tell her how much it all costs. OUTRAGEOUS these are prescribed by her consultant.... She feels bad enough physically without the added stress and embarrassment.......
Posts.Title: Zoladex.. Advice needed

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone........I have bought some and will be trying it........
Posts.Title: Rescue remedy?

Posts.Content: Please can anyone tell me about this........ I have been very Anxious since I was told have C in my other breast etc...... Now waiting for results of ct scan......no appetite, feeling really low...............I read on a post on here that you can buy a rescue remedy spray which helps......... I retired just a few days before my diagnosis .......had so many plans.....................  Is it one of those dr Bach remedies?
Posts.Title: Rescue remedy?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone.............last time I posted was the night before my Mx 2 weeks ago..............I had a right side Mx with nodes and a reduction on my left breast, and also a lesion about half an inch under my right breast removed (they thought that could be a skin cancer.............) I had an MRI after my second mammogram because nothing much was showing on them.......... they told me that my left breast was clear............. Went yesterday for dressings off and results.........they removed 26 nodes and 17 of them were cancerous.........BUT they said that they had also found cancer in the tissue from my other breast..........the one which the MRI Had. shown as clear???????? And they said that the lesion was a skin cancer ...........which in itself was no problem because that kind of cancer doesn't spread .........and once removed is gone............ However they found breast cancer in THAT as well.........which means, they say that the cancer in my R breast has spread into the skin around my R breast............I thought that lesion was caused by the underwire in my bras rubbing.........kept meaning to mention it to my GP over the last few months I am going back for a CAT scan today to see if the cancer has spread anywhere else.......if it has then I will have CHEMO ..........if not I will have a second Mx on the left..................this is so unbelievable ...........I just went for a routine mammogram ...........no lumps, pain, puckering or thickening......................I am just stunned .........thank heaven they have organised the scan so quickly.......have to bear the waiting for a relatively short time................ The surgeon and BCN said they were surprised as well and not expecting this..........and they were so sad about it all. ...............think that I would have preferred them to be a bit upbeat ...................I will continue to put one foot in front of the other and hope ..................where has if all come from.........and why do I have no symptoms .................don ' t really expect an answer to those questions ...............just going on a bit................Don't know how this will post..........have used full stops to divide paragraphs etc...............cos the IPAD doesn't do that.......
Posts.Title: Can't believe this

Posts.Content: I have been on letrozole for almost a year. I have not noticed any hair thinning and when I mentioned it to my hairdresser, who i have seen regularly for years she has seen none either.. I have also not had any hot flushes, i am 63 and was post menopause when diagnosed.....i never had any hot flushes when i went through that either. I am on letrozole and apart from surgery have had no other treatment because my cancer had spread. I have had a scan six months ago and due another one soon. The scan showed that my cancer was being held and there was no further spread and some reduction......so letrozole is doing its magic. Side effects for me are aching joints, but i am willing to put up with that for as long as letrozole works.......
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi I have been taking it for 6 weeks. It stops your body from producing oestrogen so it helps if your cancer is Er+. It has some side effects.......hot flushes.....tho I haven't had any. ........also aching joints and bones. Obviously not everyone has side effects. I have had some but not too bad...................there will probably be others along with more experience of it. Have you been prescribed it?
Posts.Title: letrazole

Posts.Content: It was the other way around for me. The surgeon was not at all supportive of my having a bilateral. The oncologist was. Initially I had a R mx and anx clearance. I was considering a DIEP recon and so when they did the R Mx they also did a reduction in the left breast to save doing it later. However when they analysed the tissue removed from the left breast, and despite the MRI showing it as clear they found cancer in the left side as well. I also had 'shadows' in the peritoneal area (abdomen) Which were 'probably' cancer so using tissue from there for a DIEP was compromised. I told my surgeon that I would just prefer a bilateral with no reconstruction. I had a temporary expander in the right breast so they would have to perform some sort of op eventually to remove that. The surgeon wanted me to have that replaced and just carry on ......it was futile he said to perform a bilateral since the cancer had already spread. I also have some bone mets. They put me on hormone therapy and just kept filling up the temporary expander, every time I saw the surgeon I told him that under the new circumstances I just wanted both breasts to go. After three months I had a tumour marker blood test which showed a 'huge drop'......a good sign, and my BCN said that they may, because of that reconsider the bilateral op. A meeting was held with the oncologist, the surgeon, the BCN, a psychologist , myself and my husband. The surgeon reiterated that it was futile surgery, but the Onc did say that since I had to have surgery anyway - to sort out this temporary expander - that it wasn't saving me a general anasthetic - and he could understand how I felt since in my mind it was reducing the amount of cancer in my body. I didn't get on too well with the expander, found it uncomfortable, but I know many people who are perfectly happy with implants Eventually the surgeon agreed, and I had a bilateral op three months later. I must say that the surgeon was a very nice man and I had full faith in him as a surgeon and his abilities, but he just had different opinions, he did say that my feelings were important and once he agreed to operate he never mentioned it again. I am much happier now. I wear a double prosthesis when I am out and about and go flat sometimes. So whether the Onc or the surgeon decides it seems to be a matter of their opinions, feelings, etc. whereas I think that it is OUR -the person with the disease - who should have the last say. I am in my early sixties so that may have some bearing on how I felt. A recent scan has shown that the mets in both the peritoneal area and the bones have reduced, some have disappeared!!! And my tumour markers continue to fall .......so I am hoping to be around with my flat chest for some time. :-))........".................?..........................sorry I did use paragraphs when I typed this, but they don't work on iPads for some reason.
Posts.Title: Fighting for a double mastectomy...

Posts.Content: Hello. I have just had another CT scan because I have been on LETROZOLE now for just over 6 months. The scan results this time were good. No new spread....I have secondaries but they have either remained the same or reduced in my bones. The peritoneal area has - "almost completely resolved'. - so obviously we ' re moving in the right direction. However when the nurse was telling me these results I realised that I had missed some details on my first "results feedback"........nurse today told me that the mets in my pelvis were reducing. Now I was unaware that I had mets in my pelvis. When I just now looked at the notes I had jotted down when I was being given my first set of results I see that I have actually written the word 'pelvis'. I was so shocked when being given the first lot of results that I just jotted down odd words. My husband comes with me for results now but to be honest he is as wobbly as I am. I have decided that in order to be fully informed I would like copies of my results etc. I have never been offered them but understand that I am entitled to them. Should I ask for them? I am concerned that they make say I don't need them or something. Now that I am 7 months down the line I am feeling much more confident.......still wish it had never happened.......don't we all.....but want to be fully aware of everything now.
Posts.Title: Copies of results etc.
